name: Toyoko Inn Haneda Airport 1

reviews.text: Our eta into Haneda was at 1030pm. Thus, we needed a hotel near the airport for a one night transit before heading into Tokyo the next morning after a good night rest.
reviews.title: Serves its purpose well...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Toyoko Inn Haneda Airport 1 was perfect for this purpose. It had a great yet smallish airport shuttle pick-up from all the airport terminals until 12.12am. Even if we missed the shuttle, the hotel was close enough that the taxi fare wouldn't have burnt too big a hole in our pocket ;))
reviews.title: A cheap option near Haneda Airport

reviews.text: There were slightly more than 10 passengers (including the four of us) so the hotel was quite popular. It is after all, one of the cheaper options amongst the airport hotels.
reviews.title: Best place for overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Perfect for late night arrival in Tokyo

reviews.text: 7Eleven right across the hotel. The Toyoko Inn Haneda 2 right next door. The train station right after that. Along a main road but not busy.
reviews.title: Great for transiting to Haneda Airport

reviews.text: Rooms are small but adequate in size. Smartly configured, practically appointed, and VERY clean and comfortable. Incredibly strong shower pressure- a delight when you arrive after midnight after a long day of travel, and all you want is to feel fresh and clean again so that you can sleep and travel again too soon. And you sleep very well here. Comfortable bed and clean pillow, sheet, blanket. Amenities even provided. What more do you need? A/C works, as do TV and blowdrier, all this for such a reasonable price (less than $80 for one person, a little more for a double). Hotel provides a shuttle to the airport with frequent service. I had to take a taxi from Haneda TO the hotel because I arrived at 100am- last shuttles run around 10:00pm. Cost of taxi - a very reasonable 1250 yen. Breakfast and coffee served on premises- and vending machines offer a variety cold drinks, including Asahi beer. Free internet in the lobby, with many comfortable chairs and tables to wait for the shuttle or your friends. Also, hotel staff kindly, expertly, practically and professionally store your luggage for you free of charge- pretty much a necessity since check out is at an early 10:00 a.m. Two minute walk to the subway- Otori station- direct shot to Asakusa area (but not every train is direct). Lovely little bakery on the street entrance to the subway. A Seven- Eleven just across the street, too. Perfect little hotel for a short stay, despite the diminutive room and bathroom size.
reviews.title: Hard to beat for a transit stop!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night in this hotel for a nine-hour transit at Haneda Airport. The hotel-airport shuttle service is good and on-time, it only takes 10 minutes. Check-in is smooth and the WiFi is free. A set of moisture mask and pyjama are given to us for free at check-in. The room is tiny and cramped but this is the norm for all the hotels in Tokyo. Given the price is about US$100 per night, I have no complaint.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for Overnight Stay

reviews.text: This is an inexpensive hotel near Haneda. Very small room, clean
reviews.title: inexpensive hotel near Haneda

reviews.text: with free wi-fi. Free 'continental' breakfast and free
reviews.title: Good for a quick night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: shuttle bus to the airport. Decent front desk service.
reviews.title: Close to Haneda and meets basic needs, no fluff

reviews.text: I am also a frequent traveler and thought this was a decent place to relax after late night arrival and early morning departure. Contrary to the other post, I smelt nothing. Perhaps because I always stay at a non-smoking room. In the non-smoking rooms, I had no problem with the cleanliness. The room are designed small to minimize price- if you want a larger and better room, please stay at Excel Tokyu in Haneda. It's a bit unfair to complain about room size, this is Japan, Tokyo, and a Toyoko Inn. It is cheaper than a Holiday Inn in New York, cleaner and more comfortable, although the room might be a little smaller. This hotel is good enough to take a shower, perhaps a bath, for a clean toilet, comfortable enough nap, a coffee and light breakfast before you depart for another location. It does its job. Air con works okay, as long as you know how to use the controller and adjust the temperature and strength of airflow (if you don't, ask the hotel management).
reviews.title: Decent Refuge Near Haneda Airport
Disaster. Nightmare.
reviews.text: We are frequent travellers and have travelled a lot in Europe and Asia. We have visited Japan several times and stayed in many hotels in different category. Our room in Toyoko Inn Haneda Airport 1 is the dirtiest one we have ever seen in Japan. The room had a strange aweful smell. The quilt, the curtains and the slippers were disgusting that we did not want to touch. After one night stay in this hotel, my husband and I were ill, probably it's not a coincidence. It was really a nightmare. Furthermore, their check-out time is 10 am without notice during check-in. We just received a call at 10:15 am from the front desk to ask us to leave, they gave us 15 min. to pack up, otherwise we needed to pay for the extra charge.
Japan is a very clean very tidy country, but we have to say that this hotel is a disaster.
reviews.title: Excellent if you're travelling through Haneda airport

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as we needed a night's rest in Tokyo as a stop-over for both our inbound flight to Sapporo and outbound flight to Toronto. It was very convenient since this hotel offers free shuttle service to/from the airport. The only thing to keep note is there's no shuttle service in the morning/early afternoon from the airport to the hotel, so we had to take the subway during that time, but even that wasn't too bad since it's only a few stops from the airport and the exit is pretty much right beside the hotel. The stay itself was good, since Toyoko Inns are standardized. They're all clean, supply all needed basic amenities and affordable. The receptionist spoke very good Japanese too.
reviews.title: Good hotel for Business Traveller

aka: Toyoko Inn Haneda Airport 1 Tokyo, Japan
